p: Previous studies had demonstrated the bioactivity of the C. subavenium. For example, Wang et al. demonstrated the stems of C. subavenium had good pigmentation inhibitory abilities [ 12]. Cheng et al. found that the leaves and stems of C. subavenium had antioxidative activities [ 19]. Ho et al. reported that the leaf oils of C. subavenium had good antimicrobial activities [ 13]. Chen et al. reported the extraction of C. subavenium leaves had inhibition to various cancer cell lines [ 20]. So in this study, we analyzed the leaf oil of C. subavenium by GC-MS, and anti-inflammatory effects with LPS-induced RAW264.7 cells and Carr-induced paw edema in mice.
